column4: what are the advantage of using ubuntu 7.04 server edition than debian etch ? (i am very familiar with debian on the server, i hav not tested ubuntu thou)
well i guess ubuntu is a lot faster in distribuitin cycles (6 month static)
even though i myself prefer debian on my server.. i can allways get some unstable stuff and think stability > features.
okey, thx. i will look up what version of mysqld, php ubuntu got, and se if i need the newer packages from it rather then the ones that are in debian
right now feisty and etch are pretty close together but the next ubuntu version is due in about 5 month... debian will probably be more than a year
again.. debian got unstable.. so no big deal there.
heh, i don't want to run debian unstable on the server
well they got testing as well ;)
im not talking about updateing the whole system though just pick a few packages from testing and/or unstable to fit your version needs
that is okey, but a security risk thou, but indeed it will work ..
im no authority on ubuntu server (since i dont use them) but i guess they are in any case not as stable as debian - i mean how can they? they take stuff from testing/unstable themselfes
yeah, that's right but i asumed they have tested the unstable/testing packages more than the unstable/testing packages in debian
well i guess so :) who knows
that's why i wrote the first question ;)
thx for your thoughts about it
not much more left for me to say then... thats pretty much all i know ;)
